examples: the dissident was allowed to leave the country

verb.description: Give the necessary time or opportunity for.
examples: they agreed to a ceasefire to allow talks with the government
he stopped for a moment to allow his eyes to adjust
my household duties were too many to allow of a visit to the hospital
he allowed that the penalty appeared too harsh for the crime

origin: Middle English (originally in the senses commend, sanction and assign as a right): from Old French alouer, from Latin allaudare to praise, reinforced by medieval Latin allocare to place (see allocate).
